title: Tagging emails with specific key words to make finding relevant emails easily
content:
I would like to add specific tags to my emails, e.g. key words/phrases like "DNA Match", "Chichester", etc. I have gigabytes of saved emails with valuable information, but finding things I know I have, is impossible.

How can I do that?

The colour code tags are useless due to limited number, and also because I colour code genealogy/family history emails as green, I have thousands of "green" emails. I need a better system.

If Thunderbird is not the right email client to use, what is?
creator: semelbguy

title: if I delete thunderbird email and reinstall will my emai folders still remain?
content: If i delete thunderbird email program will my emails folders still remain when I reinstall? Thanks
creator: rdberryarchitect

title: Address book
content: I have been using Thunderbird for years on my old computer but how do I import my address book from old to new computer please - I use gmail. Please give me detailed instructions as I am not a computer technician.
creator: ainsliecol

title: Lost password
content: Hi Folks. About a year and a half ago I some how got hacked in communication with a help desk somewhere. From that point on , I have not been able to use my Thunderbird email. It asks for my password that I do not have. I have spent hours trying to reset it. I have tried a clean reinstall, but it recognizes me and asks for my password. I have my email addresses saved and would be happy to do a fresh install, but I have not been able to figure out how to do this. I am very much obliged for any help you may offer. Thanks Tom Adams , tnaa9@comcast.net 616 334 2342 , Grandville MI USA
creator: tnaa9

title: I’ve successfully added all my email accounts to thunderbird but one won’t verify…
content: The account I’m trying to add is an alternate domain of a Google workspace account. I’ve successfully added a few alternate domains of the same account, I’m certain my user and password information is correct, but it won’t let me add it. What could be the problem?
creator: me414

title: Replies to my sent email, land in the Sent items folder, not the Inbox
content:
I'm new to Thunderbird so this behavior has me stumped. I sent an email to a friend. My friend received this email. When my friend replied to the email, their reply did not land in my Inbox but rather the Sent items folder. I'm using Outlook.com. I've unchecked "Save a copy in Sent Items" as I was getting duplicates in my sent folder. I've disabled Threaded view as I've seen that recommended as a solution.

I just tried it again and still, their replies end up in my Sent folder vs the Inbox. Obviously this isn't normal email behavior so I'm stumped.

If I close Thunderbird and do the same thing using the Outlook web client, replies correctly land in my inbox.

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks!
creator: moelassus
